message_1: Suppose we have a substitution cipher where every letter in the alphabet is replaced by its corresponding position in the alphabet (A=1, B=2, C=3, etc.) and then shifted 5 letters to the right (modulo 26). What is the resulting cipher text for the message "HELLO WORLD"?
message_2:
To solve this problem, we will first convert each letter in the message "HELLO WORLD" to its corresponding position in the alphabet, then shift each position 5 letters to the right (modulo 26), and finally convert the shifted positions back to letters.

1. Convert the message to its corresponding positions in the alphabet:
   H  E  L  L  O   W  O  R  L  D
   8  5 12 12 15  23 15 18 12  4

2. Shift each position 5 letters to the right (modulo 26):
   8+5  5+5 12+5 12+5 15+5  23+5 15+5 18+5 12+5  4+5
   13   10  17  17  20   2  20  23  17  9

   Note: For the letter W (23), when we add 5, we get 28. Since we are working modulo 26, we subtract 26 from 28 to get 2.

3. Convert the shifted positions back to letters:
   M  J  Q  Q  T   B  T  W  Q  I

The resulting cipher text for the message "HELLO WORLD" is "MJQQT BTWQI".
